titleStmt.title: The first part of the life and raigne of King Henrie the IIII. Extending to the end of the first yeare of his raigne. Written by I.H.
Historie of the life and raigne of Henry the Fourth
titleStmt.author: Hayward, John, Sir, 1564?-1627.

publicationStmt.publisher: By [E. Allde and T. Judson for] Iohn Woolfe, and are to be solde at his shop in Popes head Alley, neere to the Exchange,

notesStmt.note: The first 100 pages deal primarily with the reign of Richard II.
"Judson pr[inted]. quires B-M, Allde the rest"--STC.
Running title reads: The life and raigne of K. Henrie the fourth.
This edition has an ornament with a fleur-de-lys on the title page; A2r, line 22 has "Teucer".
With a dated colophon. Variant 1: imprint has "Wolfe". Variant 2: colophon undated.
For more information on this and the succeeding editions, see "The Library", 3 (1902), p. 13-23; 11 (1930), p. 212-24; 15 (1934), p. 372-6; and 11 (1956), p. 1-10.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
